Job Posting:174823 - Position: W26 Junior Data Analyst Co-op (8-month role) 174823B Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Winter App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 11/03/2025 09:00 AM Through Employer Website 10/27/2025 01:59 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization City Province / State Country Waterwprth Victoria BC Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Winter W26 Junior Data Analyst Co-op (8-month role) 174823B Co-op Position Victoria, BC Canada 8 months CAD 0.0 per hour for 0 Major List $25 - $28 per hour Junior Data Analyst Co-op (8-month role) Location: Victoria, BC Start Date: January 12, 2026 Salary: $25 - $28 per hour About Waterworth Waterworth is a fast-growing, trailblazing SaaS company here in Victoria. We empower more than 350 municipalities across North America, allowing them to take control of their futures through our proprietary financial modelling and analysis. As a mission-driven company, we value innovation, collaboration, and making a real impact in the communities we serve. Join us as we continue to grow and deliver valuable financial tools to the public sector. The Role We're looking for a motivated Junior Data Analyst Co-op to support the data onboarding, analysis, and forecasting needs of our Client Success team. This co-op position is ideal for a student who has completed a prior co-op and is studying commerce, economics, finance, or maths. You'll play a key role in ensuring the accuracy and usability of client data, while helping improve processes that drive client retention and success. In addition to your data-focused responsibilities, you'll contribute to system- building efforts that support our overall operations. Key Responsibilities: Data Onboarding & Transformation: • Import and validate client financial statements, capital project data, and utility billing information. • Transform and standardise data for seamless integration into the Waterworth platform. Forecasting & Analysis: • Conduct data analysis to track client engagement, churn, and meeting outcomes, focusing on identifying patterns that drive client success. • Collaborate with the Client Success team to analyse client behavior and provide insights that help improve retention and satisfaction. Collaboration & Communication: • Work closely with the Implementation and Product teams to improve data handling and reporting processes. Communicate technical findings and insights clearly to both technical and non-technical stakeholders. • Documentation: • Create clear, reusable documentation for data transformation workflows and onboarding processes. Ensure documentation is easily accessible for team members and clients. • Why Waterworth? • Impactful Work: Help communities thrive by providing financial forecasting tools that empower local governments to make data- driven decisions. • Career Development: Gain exposure to SaaS, data analysis, financial modeling, and the public sector, all while contributing to meaningful work. • Dynamic Team Culture: Join a team that's fast-paced, fun, and passionate about the work we do. • Learning Opportunities: Waterworth offers a supportive environment where you'll gain valuable skills, receive mentorship, and have opportunities to grow within the company. How to Apply Ready to make a real impact while gaining valuable experience? We want to hear from you! Please submit your resume and get in touch! Job Requirements What We're Looking For: • Educational Background: Currently pursuing a degree in commerce, economics, finance, mathematics, or a related field. • Analytical Skills: Proven experience with problem solving techniques • Attention to Detail: Ability to ensure accuracy and consistency in data handling and financial models. • Tech-Savvy: Familiarity with data manipulation tools (Excel - or any other equivalent!) and an interest in learning SaaS tools and platforms. • Leadership Experience: Active participation in student societies or extracurricular activities, particularly if you've held a leadership role, is a definite plus. Communication Skills: Ability to communicate technical information clearly and collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through Employer Website Special Application Instructions Application Link: https://apply.workable.com/waterworth/j/C8B8392B8D/ Please click the "I intend to apply to this position" button on SCOPE and also submit your application via the employer's website. Applications are accepted on a rolling basis and the posting may be expired at any time by the employer as submissions are received. Students should submit their applications as soon as they are ready.
